answers.answer: Could be. You need to see an Eye MD ophthalmologist-physician to rule out a problem such as a blood clot that involves the macula that might cause that.You can find one near you at www.aao.orgJCH III MD
Do blood clots cause bright spots? I presumed they would cause dark spots and be visible all the time, not just on blinking ... is that incorrect?
Small amounts of blood or inflammatory fluid might cause the problem you describe. Hopefully that won't be the case.JCH III MD

i occasionally have this problem as well. i only see the spot right after i blink. it effects my left eye and it is similar to afterburn from a camera flash, but it is not there all the time.i began to notice it 5 months ago. i also have strange flashers from time to time. i have seen an opthamologist twice who noticed a "spot" on one of my nerve endings. i have has LOTS of tests done (mri of spine, bloodwork) and nothing has turned up. on my second opthomologist visit, that "spot" on my nerve had disappeared...very mysterious...does anyone else know what this is? he had also suggested it could have been a cotton wool spot, but i am doubtful of this.
See response to your questions "eye problem"JCH III MD

question: I have a bright spot in my eye as though I have looked at a bright light. It's just in my right eye and has been there for three days now. I notice it every time I blink. Just when I think it is gone, it's there again. I am 35 female and healthy - blood pressure on the low side of normal, take no meds, no diabetes or weight problems etc.I have an eye exam very year with a doctor, don't wear glasses. Does this sound like a serious problem?
title: BRight spot
